page.title: 12Uckfield Bypass, Horsted.
page.content: A bypass for{Uckfield}was suggested in the 1930's but a route was not approved until 1975. Work started in {February 1984.}It is on target for its scheduled completion in{May 1986. When finished about 12000 vehicles will use the Bypass each day. At pres- ent 5000 vehicles per day use the A26 south of Uckfield but two thirds are expected to turn onto the Bypass at the Horsted roundabout. Areas to its north and south have been cut away and embankments made. About{65000 square m of farmland &{23000 square m}of wood- land have been taken from this area. {Culverts}have been built where the Ridgewood Stream meets the Bypass and the Stream diverted for about 300 m. Retaining the existing channel would have been too costly. Once the Works in the Valley have been left to settle the road surface can be laid.
